[21:37:25]: Removing a Tags From "Growing up, you never tried to lie to get what you wanted, and even when necessary, lying makes you uncomfortable. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Perception checks to <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Actions.aspx?ID=85">Sense Motive</a> and to Perception DCs against attempts to Lie to you. Furthermore, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Skills.aspx?ID=6">Diplomacy</a> checks to convince others you speak the truth when you are telling the truth, and you take a –4 circumstance penalty to <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Actions.aspx?ID=47">Lie</a> and to your Deception DC against Sense Motive.".

[21:37:25]: Removing a Tags From "Your blood runs hearty and strong, and you can shake off toxins. You gain poison resistance equal to half your level (minimum 1), and each of your successful saving throws against a <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=126">poison</a> affliction reduces its stage by 2, or by 1 for a <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=162">virulent</a> poison. Each critical success against an ongoing poison reduces its stage by 3, or by 2 for a virulent poison.

You also gain a +2 circumstance bonus to locate undetected creatures that you could hear within 30 feet with a Seek action.".

[21:38:21]: Found Heritage: Chameleon Gnome.
[21:38:21]: Removing a Tags From "The color of your hair and skin is mutable, possibly due to latent magic. You can slowly change the vibrancy and the exact color, and the coloration can be different across your body, allowing you to create patterns or other colorful designs. It takes a single action for minor localized shifts and up to an hour for dramatic shifts throughout your body. While you're asleep, the colors shift on their own in tune with your dreams, giving you an unusual coloration each morning. When you're in an area where your coloration is roughly similar to the environment (for instance, forest green in a forest), you can use the single action to make minor localized shifts designed to help you blend into your surroundings. This grants you a +2 circumstance bonus to <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Skills.aspx?ID=15">Stealth</a> checks until your surroundings shift in coloration or pattern.".
[21:38:21]: Start: 759.
[21:38:21]: ['Chameleon Gnome', 'https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=11', 'Gnome', "The color of your hair and skin is mutable, possibly due to latent magic. You can slowly change the vibrancy and the exact color, and the coloration can be different across your body, allowing you to create patterns or other colorful designs. It takes a single action for minor localized shifts and up to an hour for dramatic shifts throughout your body. While you're asleep, the colors shift on their own in tune with your dreams, giving you an unusual coloration each morning. When you're in an area where your coloration is roughly similar to the environment (for instance, forest green in a forest), you can use the single action to make minor localized shifts designed to help you blend into your surroundings. This grants you a +2 circumstance bonus to Stealth checks until your surroundings shift in coloration or pattern."].

[21:38:21]: Removing a Tags From "The blood of the fey is so strong within you that you're truly one of them. You gain the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=69">fey</a> trait, in addition to the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=80">gnome</a> and <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=91">humanoid</a> traits. Choose one cantrip from the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4">primal</a> spell list. You can cast this spell as a primal innate spell at will. A cantrip is heightened to a spell level equal to half your level rounded up. You can change this cantrip to a different one from the same list once per day by meditating to realign yourself with the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Planes.aspx?ID=10">First World</a>; this is a 10-minute activity that has the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=32">concentrate</a> trait.".

You might cast a denser shadow, have a slower pulse, or find comfort in the embrace of darkness. You gain cold or negative resistance equal to half your level (minimum 1), chosen when you gain this heritage.".

You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to locate <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Conditions.aspx?ID=39">undetected</a> creatures within 60 feet when using the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Actions.aspx?ID=84">Seek</a> action. Your flat check to target <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Conditions.aspx?ID=4">concealed</a> creatures is DC 3 instead of DC 5, and your flat check to target undetected creatures is DC 9 instead of DC 11.".

[21:40:54]: Removing a Tags From "Your ancestors' exposure to the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Planes.aspx?ID=11">Shadow Plane</a> wrought great physical changes. Your hair or skin sometimes appears insubstantial, and you're slighter and more agile than other fetchlings. You're Small instead of Medium. You gain the trained proficiency rank in <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Skills.aspx?ID=1">Acrobatics</a>, the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Feats.aspx?ID=828">Quick Squeeze</a> skill feat, and a +1 circumstance bonus to Acrobatics checks to <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Actions.aspx?ID=29">Tumble Through</a>. If you would automatically become trained in Acrobatics (from your background or class, for example), you instead become trained in a skill of your choice.<h1 class="title">Versatile Heritages</h1><b>Source</b> <a href="https://paizo.com/products/btq022bc" target="_blank" class="external-link"><i>Advanced Player's Guide pg. 28</i></a> <sup><a href="Sources.aspx?ID=39" class="external-link">2.0</a></sup>".

[21:42:10]: Found Heritage: Steelskin Hobgoblin.
[21:42:10]: Removing a Tags From "When you are cut or burned, your body responds by forming tough but flexible callouses over the site of the injury. Over time, this makes the most vulnerable sections of your body harder and more resistant to damage. Many steelskin hobgoblins intentionally use blades and flame to scar themselves in intricate patterns, though this isn't universal. Your flat check to recover from <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Conditions.aspx?ID=29">persistent physical (including bleed), energy, or poison damage</a> is DC 13 (rather than DC 15), or DC 8 when provided particularly effective assistance.".

[21:42:34]: Found Heritage: Frozen Wind Kitsune.
[21:42:34]: Removing a Tags From "Your ancestors crossed the Crown of the World or resided on snowy peaks. You gain cold resistance equal to half your level (minimum 1). You treat <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Rules.aspx?ID=642">environmental cold effects</a> as if they were one step less extreme (incredible cold becomes extreme, extreme cold becomes severe, and so on). Your alternate form is a common Medium humanoid ancestry prevalent where you grew up (typically <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Ancestries.aspx?ID=6">human</a>), called a tailless form.<h1 class="title">Versatile Heritages</h1><b>Source</b> <a href="https://paizo.com/products/btq022bc" target="_blank" class="external-link"><i>Advanced Player's Guide pg. 28</i></a> <sup><a href="Sources.aspx?ID=39" class="external-link">2.0</a></sup>".

You can use your clawed feet and tail to <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Actions.aspx?ID=33">Climb</a>, leaving your hands free. Additionally, if you succeed at an <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Skills.aspx?ID=3">Athletics</a> check to Climb, you critically succeed instead.".

When Climbing rock walls, stalactites, and other natural stone features, you move at half your Speed on a success and at full Speed on a critical success (and you move at full Speed on a success if you have <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Feats.aspx?ID=821">Quick Climb</a>). This doesn't affect you if you're using a climb Speed. If you roll a success on an <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Skills.aspx?ID=1">Acrobatics</a> check to <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Actions.aspx?ID=31">Squeeze</a>, you get a critical success instead.".

[21:43:24]: Removing a Tags From "Your body continually produces small fruits imbued with primal magic. At dawn each day, a new fruit ripens. You or an ally can remove this fruit as an Interact action. If a living creature that can derive sustenance from fruit consumes it as an Interact action within the next hour, they regain 1d8 Hit Points, plus an additional 1d8 Hit Points for every 2 of your levels beyond 1st. This effect has the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=89">healing</a>, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=117">necromancy</a>, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=128">positive</a>, and <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=134">primal</a> traits.".

[21:43:24]: Found Heritage: Gourd Leshy.
[21:43:24]: Removing a Tags From "You have a large gourd for a skull. Your knowledge comes from within your spirit, rather than a physical brain, and you have found a handier use for the space inside your head. You can store a collection of up to 1 Bulk of objects within your head. The DC of checks to <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Actions.aspx?ID=68">Steal</a> objects from inside your head increases by 4. Additionally, if you store only one object within your head, you can draw it effortlessly into your hand as part of another action to use the object. Drawing the item grants this other action the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Actions.aspx?ID=639">manipulate</a> trait.".

[21:44:43]: Found Heritage: Desert Rat.
[21:44:43]: Removing a Tags From "You are native to arid plains and likely grew up traveling the roads. You have a leaner build than other ratfolk, with longer limbs and short fur. If you have both hands free, you can increase your Speed to 30 feet as you run on all fours. In addition, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Rules.aspx?ID=642">environmental heat effects</a> are one step less extreme for you, and you can go 10 times as long as normal before you are affected by starvation or thirst. However, unless you wear protective gear or take shelter, environmental cold effects are one step more extreme for you.".
[21:44:43]: Start: 253.

In addition, environmental heat effects are one step less extreme for you, and you can go 10 times as long as normal before you are affected by starvation or thirst. However, unless you wear protective gear or take shelter, environmental cold effects are one step more extreme for you.'].
[21:44:43]: Found Heritage: Longsnout Rat.
[21:44:43]: Removing a Tags From "The long snouts that run in your family give you a keener sense of smell than most ratfolk. You gain <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Rules.aspx?ID=417">imprecise scent</a> with a range of 30 feet. This means you can use your sense of smell to determine a creature’s location. The GM will usually double the range if you’re downwind from the creature or halve the range if you’re upwind.".

Each critical success against an ongoing disease or poison reduces its stage by 3, or by 2 for a virulent disease or poison.".

[21:47:42]: Found Heritage: Vigilant Goloma.
[21:47:42]: Removing a Tags From "You've learned to be aware of not just obvious physical dangers, but also noticeable magical threats. You can cast the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Spells.aspx?ID=66"><i>detect magic</i></a> cantrip as an arcane innate spell at will. A cantrip is heightened to a spell level equal to half your level rounded up. In addition, your awareness allows you to notice magical traps easier than others. Your proficiency rank in Perception is considered one step better when attempting to detect magical traps. (Trained is considered expert, expert is considered master, and master is considered legendary).<h1 class="title">Versatile Heritages</h1><b>Source</b> <a href="https://paizo.com/products/btq022bc" target="_blank" class="external-link"><i>Advanced Player's Guide pg. 28</i></a> <sup><a href="Sources.aspx?ID=39" class="external-link">2.0</a></sup>".

A cantrip is heightened to a spell level equal to half your level rounded up.".

[21:48:36]: Removing a Tags From "Your metabolism is slow, allowing you to go for days without food and process maladies at a slower rate. You can go for 1 week without food before you begin to <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Rules.aspx?ID=537">starve</a>. Additionally, the onset times and lengths of stages for all <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=46">diseases</a> and <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=126">poisons</a> that affect you are increased by 50%. If the onset time or stage is instant or lasts only 1 round, this ability has no effect.<h1 class="title">Versatile Heritages</h1><b>Source</b> <a href="https://paizo.com/products/btq022bc" target="_blank" class="external-link"><i>Advanced Player's Guide pg. 28</i></a> <sup><a href="Sources.aspx?ID=39" class="external-link">2.0</a></sup>".

[21:49:03]: Removing a Tags From "You are a rare shoony who hails from colder climes. You gain cold resistance equal to half your level (minimum 1), and you treat <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Rules.aspx?ID=642">environmental cold effects as if they were one step less extreme</a> (incredible cold becomes extreme, extreme cold becomes severe, and so on). You don’t need to succeed at a flat check to target a concealed creature if that creature is concealed only by snow. Unless you wear protective gear or take shelter, environmental heat effects are one step more extreme for you.
<h1 class="title">Versatile Heritages</h1><b>Source</b> <a href="https://paizo.com/products/btq022bc" target="_blank" class="external-link"><i>Advanced Player's Guide pg. 28</i></a> <sup><a href="Sources.aspx?ID=39" class="external-link">2.0</a></sup>".

[21:49:48]: Removing a Tags From "You have the features of a bee, butterfly, or other insect that loves sweets. You can ask questions of and receive answers from arthropods (insects, spiders, scorpions, crabs, and similar invertebrate animals), as well as use <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Skills.aspx?ID=6">Diplomacy</a> to <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Actions.aspx?ID=50">Make an Impression</a> on and <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Actions.aspx?ID=51">Request</a> things of them. Most bees, butterflies, moths, and beetles have an indifferent or friendly starting attitude toward you and give you time to make your case, though other arthropods react to you like any other adventurer.".

[21:49:48]: Removing a Tags From "You have the features of a bee, butterfly, or other insect that loves sweets. You can ask questions of and receive answers from arthropods (insects, spiders, scorpions, crabs, and similar invertebrate animals), as well as use Diplomacy to <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Actions.aspx?ID=50">Make an Impression</a> on and <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Actions.aspx?ID=51">Request</a> things of them. Most bees, butterflies, moths, and beetles have an indifferent or friendly starting attitude toward you and give you time to make your case, though other arthropods react to you like any other adventurer.".

You also gain a +2 circumstance bonus to locate undetected creatures that you could hear within 30 feet with a Seek action.".

[21:50:11]: Found Heritage: Songbird Strix.
[21:50:11]: Removing a Tags From "You descend from a talented line of strix storytellers. From the highest mountains and purest landscapes where your lungs fill with glorious clean air, you trill, whistle, and croon sweet songs. While natural sounds make you predisposed to sing, voices make you predisposed to mimicry. You receive a +1 circumstance bonus on <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Skills.aspx?ID=5">Deception</a> checks to <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Actions.aspx?ID=46">Impersonate</a> a mimicked voice, where the sound of the voice is the only factor; if you are a master in Deception, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus instead. You also gain a +1 circumstance bonus on <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Skills.aspx?ID=12">Performance</a> checks to sing; if you are a master in Performance, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus instead.<h1 class="title">Versatile Heritages</h1><b>Source</b> <a href="https://paizo.com/products/btq022bc" target="_blank" class="external-link"><i>Advanced Player's Guide pg. 28</i></a> <sup><a href="Sources.aspx?ID=39" class="external-link">2.0</a></sup>".

From the highest mountains and purest landscapes where your lungs fill with glorious clean air, you trill, whistle, and croon sweet songs. While natural sounds make you predisposed to sing, voices make you predisposed to mimicry. [21:50:11]: Start: 745.
[21:50:11]: ['Songbird Strix', 'https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=150', 'Strix', 'You descend from a talented line of strix storytellers. From the highest mountains and purest landscapes where your lungs fill with glorious clean air, you trill, whistle, and croon sweet songs. While natural sounds make you predisposed to sing, voices make you predisposed to mimicry. You receive a +1 circumstance bonus on Deception checks to Impersonate a mimicked voice, where the sound of the voice is the only factor; if you are a master in Deception, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus instead. You also gain a +1 circumstance bonus on Performance checks to sing; if you are a master in Performance, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus instead.<h1 class="title">Versatile Heritages</h1><b>Source</b> <i>Advanced Player\'s Guide pg. 28</i> <sup>2.0</sup>'].

[22:05:43]: Removing a Tags From "Whether through a connection to <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Deities.aspx?ID=18">Torag's</a> forge, the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Monsters.aspx?ID=1074">azers</a> of the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Planes.aspx?ID=6">Plane of Fire</a>, or another source, you can exude a burst of energy. Mbe'ke and Taralu dwarves of the Mwangi Expanse believe this heritage is a gift from dragons or elemental spirits. Choose one of the following damage types: acid, cold, electricity, or fire. Once chosen, this can't be changed. You gain the Energy Emanation activity.".

[22:06:38]: Found Heritage: Chameleon Gnome.
[22:06:38]: Removing a Tags From "The color of your hair and skin is mutable, possibly due to latent magic. You can slowly change the vibrancy and the exact color, and the coloration can be different across your body, allowing you to create patterns or other colorful designs. It takes a single action for minor localized shifts and up to an hour for dramatic shifts throughout your body. While you're asleep, the colors shift on their own in tune with your dreams, giving you an unusual coloration each morning. When you're in an area where your coloration is roughly similar to the environment (for instance, forest green in a forest), you can use the single action to make minor localized shifts designed to help you blend into your surroundings. This grants you a +2 circumstance bonus to <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Skills.aspx?ID=15">Stealth</a> checks until your surroundings shift in coloration or pattern.".

[22:08:14]: Found Heritage: Ancient Scale Azarketi.
[22:08:14]: Removing a Tags From "Your lineage stems from azarketis who remain dedicated to their deep-sea roots. Divorced from land society, you're a foreigner to any world above a thousand fathoms deep. You gain <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Rules.aspx?ID=415">darkvision</a>. Your body is dotted with phosphorescent spots that emit a guiding light and help you communicate. The spots—located primarily on your face, arms, and hands—illuminate a 10-foot radius around you with dim light. You can activate, deactivate, or change the arrangement of lights as an action, which has the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=86">concentration</a> trait.".
[22:08:14]: Start: 180.

You adapt to pressure changes from being deep underwater automatically without ill effect.".

Over time, your people adapted to life on land culturally and physically, even resulting in azarketis born with human hair like their Azlanti ancestors. You no longer need to be immersed in water every 24 hours to maintain your skin and can instead mist or wipe your skin with water to live comfortably. Your land Speed is 25 feet, but your swim Speed is only 15 feet.".

This doesn't affect you if you're using a climb Speed. You or an ally can remove this fruit as an Interact action. This effect has the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=89">healing</a>, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=117">necromancy</a>, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=128">positive</a>, and <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=134">primal</a> traits.".

[22:11:31]: Found Heritage: Gourd Leshy.
[22:11:31]: Removing a Tags From "You have a large gourd for a skull. Your knowledge comes from within your spirit, rather than a physical brain, and you have found a handier use for the space inside your head. You can store a collection of up to 1 Bulk of objects within your head. The DC of checks to <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Actions.aspx?ID=68">Steal</a> objects from inside your head increases by 4. Additionally, if you store only one object within your head, you can draw it effortlessly into your hand as part of another action to use the object. Drawing the item grants this other action the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Actions.aspx?ID=639">manipulate</a> trait.".
[22:11:31]: Start: 269.

[22:12:45]: Found Heritage: Deep Rat.

[22:12:45]: ['Deep Rat', 'https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=72', 'Ratfolk', 'Your ancestors lived deeper underground than other ratfolk, granting you the ability to see in the dark. You gain darkvision.'].
[22:12:45]: Found Heritage: Desert Rat.
[22:12:45]: Removing a Tags From "You are native to arid plains and likely grew up traveling the roads. You have a leaner build than other ratfolk, with longer limbs and short fur. If you have both hands free, you can increase your Speed to 30 feet as you run on all fours. In addition, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Rules.aspx?ID=642">environmental heat effects</a> are one step less extreme for you, and you can go 10 times as long as normal before you are affected by starvation or thirst. However, unless you wear protective gear or take shelter, environmental cold effects are one step more extreme for you.".
[22:12:45]: Start: 253.
[22:12:45]: ['Desert Rat', 'https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=73', 'Ratfolk', 'You are native to arid plains and likely grew up traveling the roads. You have a leaner build than other ratfolk, with longer limbs and short fur. If you have both hands free, you can increase your Speed to 30 feet as you run on all fours. In addition, environmental heat effects are one step less extreme for you, and you can go 10 times as long as normal before you are affected by starvation or thirst. However, unless you wear protective gear or take shelter, environmental cold effects are one step more extreme for you.'].
[22:12:45]: Found Heritage: Longsnout Rat.
[22:12:45]: Removing a Tags From "The long snouts that run in your family give you a keener sense of smell than most ratfolk. You gain <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Rules.aspx?ID=417">imprecise scent</a> with a range of 30 feet. This means you can use your sense of smell to determine a creature’s location. The GM will usually double the range if you’re downwind from the creature or halve the range if you’re upwind.".
[22:12:45]: Start: 101.

You gain imprecise scent with a range of 30 feet. This means you can use your sense of smell to determine a creature’s location. The GM will usually double the range if you’re downwind from the creature or halve the range if you’re upwind.'].
[22:12:45]: Found Heritage: Sewer Rat.
[22:12:45]: Removing a Tags From "You come from a long line of ysoki from a community based in the sewers beneath a large settlement. You are immune to the disease filth fever. Each of your successful saving throws against a disease or poison reduces its stage by 2, or by 1 for a <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=162">virulent</a> disease or poison. Each critical success against an ongoing disease or poison reduces its stage by 3, or by 2 for a virulent disease or poison.".
[22:12:45]: Start: 247.

[22:12:45]: Found Heritage: Shadow Rat.
[22:12:45]: Removing a Tags From "Your ancestors lived in dark spaces underground, granting you dark fur and a vaguely unnatural mien that unnerves sapient creatures and frightens animals. You gain the trained proficiency rank in <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Skills.aspx?ID=7">Intimidation</a> and can use Intimidation to <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Actions.aspx?ID=52">Coerce</a> animals. When you <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Actions.aspx?ID=53">Demoralize</a> an animal, you don’t take a penalty for not sharing a language with it. If you would automatically become trained in Intimidation (from your background or class, for example), you become trained in another skill of your choice.".

A cantrip is heightened to a spell level equal to half your level rounded up. In addition, your awareness allows you to notice magical traps easier than others. Your proficiency rank in Perception is considered one step better when attempting to detect magical traps. (Trained is considered expert, expert is considered master, and master is considered legendary).".

You don’t need to succeed at a flat check to target a concealed creature if that creature is concealed only by snow. From the highest mountains and purest landscapes where your lungs fill with glorious clean air, you trill, whistle, and croon sweet songs. You receive a +1 circumstance bonus on <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Skills.aspx?ID=5">Deception</a> checks to <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Actions.aspx?ID=46">Impersonate</a> a mimicked voice, where the sound of the voice is the only factor; if you are a master in Deception, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus instead. You also gain a +1 circumstance bonus on <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Skills.aspx?ID=12">Performance</a> checks to sing; if you are a master in Performance, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus instead.".

[22:18:16]: ['Songbird Strix', 'https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=150', 'Strix', 'You descend from a talented line of strix storytellers. From the highest mountains and purest landscapes where your lungs fill with glorious clean air, you trill, whistle, and croon sweet songs. While natural sounds make you predisposed to sing, voices make you predisposed to mimicry. You receive a +1 circumstance bonus on Deception checks to Impersonate a mimicked voice, where the sound of the voice is the only factor; if you are a master in Deception, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus instead. You also gain a +1 circumstance bonus on Performance checks to sing; if you are a master in Performance, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus instead.'].

[22:22:56]: Removing a Tags From "Growing up, you never tried to lie to get what you wanted, and even when necessary, lying makes you uncomfortable. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Perception checks to <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Actions.aspx?ID=85">Sense Motive</a> and to Perception DCs against attempts to Lie to you. Furthermore, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Skills.aspx?ID=6">Diplomacy</a> checks to convince others you speak the truth when you are telling the truth, and you take a –4 circumstance penalty to <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Actions.aspx?ID=47">Lie</a> and to your Deception DC against Sense Motive.".

[22:23:49]: Found Heritage: Chameleon Gnome.
[22:23:49]: Removing a Tags From "The color of your hair and skin is mutable, possibly due to latent magic. You can slowly change the vibrancy and the exact color, and the coloration can be different across your body, allowing you to create patterns or other colorful designs. It takes a single action for minor localized shifts and up to an hour for dramatic shifts throughout your body. While you're asleep, the colors shift on their own in tune with your dreams, giving you an unusual coloration each morning. When you're in an area where your coloration is roughly similar to the environment (for instance, forest green in a forest), you can use the single action to make minor localized shifts designed to help you blend into your surroundings. This grants you a +2 circumstance bonus to <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Skills.aspx?ID=15">Stealth</a> checks until your surroundings shift in coloration or pattern.".
[22:23:49]: Start: 759.
[22:23:49]: ['Chameleon Gnome', 'https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=11', 'Gnome', "The color of your hair and skin is mutable, possibly due to latent magic. You can slowly change the vibrancy and the exact color, and the coloration can be different across your body, allowing you to create patterns or other colorful designs. It takes a single action for minor localized shifts and up to an hour for dramatic shifts throughout your body. While you're asleep, the colors shift on their own in tune with your dreams, giving you an unusual coloration each morning. When you're in an area where your coloration is roughly similar to the environment (for instance, forest green in a forest), you can use the single action to make minor localized shifts designed to help you blend into your surroundings. This grants you a +2 circumstance bonus to Stealth checks until your surroundings shift in coloration or pattern."].
[22:23:49]: Found Heritage: Fey-Touched Gnome.
[22:23:49]: Removing a Tags From "The blood of the fey is so strong within you that you're truly one of them. You gain the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=69">fey</a> trait, in addition to the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=80">gnome</a> and <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=91">humanoid</a> traits. Choose one cantrip from the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4">primal</a> spell list. You can cast this spell as a primal innate spell at will. A cantrip is heightened to a spell level equal to half your level rounded up. You can change this cantrip to a different one from the same list once per day by meditating to realign yourself with the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Planes.aspx?ID=10">First World</a>; this is a 10-minute activity that has the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=32">concentrate</a> trait.".

[22:23:49]: Found Heritage: Sensate Gnome.
[22:23:49]: Removing a Tags From "You see all colors as brighter, hear all sounds as richer, and especially smell all scents with incredible detail. You gain a special sense: <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Rules.aspx?ID=412">imprecise</a> <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Rules.aspx?ID=417">scent</a> with a range of 30 feet. This means you can use your sense of smell to determine the exact location of a creature. The GM will usually double the range if you're downwind from the creature or halve the range if you're upwind.".

[22:25:39]: Removing a Tags From "Your lineage stems from azarketis who remain dedicated to their deep-sea roots. Your body is dotted with phosphorescent spots that emit a guiding light and help you communicate. The spots—located primarily on your face, arms, and hands—illuminate a 10-foot radius around you with dim light. You can activate, deactivate, or change the arrangement of lights as an action, which has the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=86">concentration</a> trait.".

The GM will usually double the range if you're downwind from the creature or halve the range if you're upwind.".

[22:26:35]: Removing a Tags From "Your body proves that shadow can't exist without light. Perhaps your eyes glow brighter or your veins occasionally pulse with light. Additionally, you can force fragments of your shadow to glow and cast <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Spells.aspx?ID=58"><i>dancing lights</i></a> and <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Spells.aspx?ID=171"><i>light</i></a> as occult innate cantrips. Your hair or skin sometimes appears insubstantial, and you're slighter and more agile than other fetchlings. You're Small instead of Medium. You gain the trained proficiency rank in <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Skills.aspx?ID=1">Acrobatics</a>, the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Feats.aspx?ID=828">Quick Squeeze</a> skill feat, and a +1 circumstance bonus to Acrobatics checks to <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Actions.aspx?ID=29">Tumble Through</a>. If you would automatically become trained in Acrobatics (from your background or class, for example), you instead become trained in a skill of your choice.".

You gain the trained proficiency rank in Acrobatics, the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Feats.aspx?ID=828">Quick Squeeze</a> skill feat, and a +1 circumstance bonus to Acrobatics checks to <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Actions.aspx?ID=29">Tumble Through</a>. If you would automatically become trained in Acrobatics (from your background or class, for example), you instead become trained in a skill of your choice.".

You or an ally can remove this fruit as an Interact action. If a living creature that can derive sustenance from fruit consumes it as an Interact action within the next hour, they regain 1d8 Hit Points, plus an additional 1d8 Hit Points for every 2 of your levels beyond 1st. This effect has the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=89">healing</a>, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=117">necromancy</a>, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=128">positive</a>, and <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=134">primal</a> traits.".

[22:29:33]: Found Heritage: Woodstalker Lizardfolk.
[22:29:33]: Removing a Tags From "You move easily through thick forest and jungle, using every branch or bush. You can always use the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Actions.aspx?ID=90">Take Cover</a> action when in forest or jungle terrain to gain cover, even if you're not next to an obstacle you would normally be able to Take Cover behind. You gain the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Feats.aspx?ID=852">Terrain Stalker</a> feat, even if you're not trained in <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Skills.aspx?ID=15">Stealth</a>, and you must choose underbrush as your chosen terrain.".

[22:30:22]: Found Heritage: Desert Rat.
[22:30:22]: Removing a Tags From "You are native to arid plains and likely grew up traveling the roads. You have a leaner build than other ratfolk, with longer limbs and short fur. If you have both hands free, you can increase your Speed to 30 feet as you run on all fours. In addition, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Rules.aspx?ID=642">environmental heat effects</a> are one step less extreme for you, and you can go 10 times as long as normal before you are affected by starvation or thirst. However, unless you wear protective gear or take shelter, environmental cold effects are one step more extreme for you.".
[22:30:22]: Start: 253.
[22:30:22]: ['Desert Rat', 'https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=73', 'Ratfolk', 'You are native to arid plains and likely grew up traveling the roads. You have a leaner build than other ratfolk, with longer limbs and short fur. If you have both hands free, you can increase your Speed to 30 feet as you run on all fours. In addition, environmental heat effects are one step less extreme for you, and you can go 10 times as long as normal before you are affected by starvation or thirst. However, unless you wear protective gear or take shelter, environmental cold effects are one step more extreme for you.'].
[22:30:22]: Found Heritage: Longsnout Rat.
[22:30:22]: Removing a Tags From "The long snouts that run in your family give you a keener sense of smell than most ratfolk. You gain <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Rules.aspx?ID=417">imprecise scent</a> with a range of 30 feet. This means you can use your sense of smell to determine a creature’s location. The GM will usually double the range if you’re downwind from the creature or halve the range if you’re upwind.".
[22:30:22]: Start: 101.

The GM will usually double the range if you’re downwind from the creature or halve the range if you’re upwind.'].

[22:30:22]: Removing a Tags From "You come from a long line of ysoki from a community based in the sewers beneath a large settlement. You are immune to the disease filth fever. Each of your successful saving throws against a disease or poison reduces its stage by 2, or by 1 for a <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=162">virulent</a> disease or poison. Each critical success against an ongoing disease or poison reduces its stage by 3, or by 2 for a virulent disease or poison.".

[22:30:22]: Found Heritage: Shadow Rat.
[22:30:22]: Removing a Tags From "Your ancestors lived in dark spaces underground, granting you dark fur and a vaguely unnatural mien that unnerves sapient creatures and frightens animals. When you <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Actions.aspx?ID=53">Demoralize</a> an animal, you don’t take a penalty for not sharing a language with it. If you would automatically become trained in Intimidation (from your background or class, for example), you become trained in another skill of your choice.".

[22:30:48]: Found Heritage: Jinxed Tengu.
[22:30:48]: Removing a Tags From "Your lineage has been exposed to curse after curse, and now, they slide off your feathers like rain. If you succeed at a saving throw against a <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=38">curse</a> or <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=110">misfortune</a> effect, you get a critical success instead. When you would gain the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Conditions.aspx?ID=9">doomed</a> condition, attempt a DC 17 flat check. On a success, reduce the value of the doomed condition you would gain by 1.".
[22:30:48]: Start: 144.
[22:30:48]: Removing a Tags From "Your lineage has been exposed to curse after curse, and now, they slide off your feathers like rain. If you succeed at a saving throw against a curse or <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=110">misfortune</a> effect, you get a critical success instead. When you would gain the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Conditions.aspx?ID=9">doomed</a> condition, attempt a DC 17 flat check. On a success, reduce the value of the doomed condition you would gain by 1.".

You gain cold resistance equal to half your level (minimum 1), and you treat <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Rules.aspx?ID=642">environmental cold effects as if they were one step less extreme</a> (incredible cold becomes extreme, extreme cold becomes severe, and so on). You don’t need to succeed at a flat check to target a concealed creature if that creature is concealed only by snow. Unless you wear protective gear or take shelter, environmental heat effects are one step more extreme for you.".

[22:35:44]: Found Heritage: Scavenger Strix.
[22:35:44]: Removing a Tags From "Your ancestors originated from a land where food was scarce and threats were many. You are trained in <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Skills.aspx?ID=16">Survival</a>. You gain the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Feats.aspx?ID=786">Forager</a> skill feat as a bonus feat. Your thoroughness when gathering food provides you a +1 circumstance bonus to Survival checks to <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Actions.aspx?ID=27">Subsist</a>.".

[22:35:44]: ['Shoreline Strix', 'https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=149', 'Strix', "You're the descendant of strix who traveled to the coasts. Your feathers are especially water-repellent and sleekly angled for diving, allowing you to catch fish and other prey in the shallows. You are trained in Athletics, and you gain the Underwater Marauder skill feat as a bonus skill feat."].
[22:35:44]: Found Heritage: Songbird Strix.
[22:35:44]: Removing a Tags From "You descend from a talented line of strix storytellers. From the highest mountains and purest landscapes where your lungs fill with glorious clean air, you trill, whistle, and croon sweet songs. While natural sounds make you predisposed to sing, voices make you predisposed to mimicry. You receive a +1 circumstance bonus on <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Skills.aspx?ID=5">Deception</a> checks to <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Actions.aspx?ID=46">Impersonate</a> a mimicked voice, where the sound of the voice is the only factor; if you are a master in Deception, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus instead. You also gain a +1 circumstance bonus on <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Skills.aspx?ID=12">Performance</a> checks to sing; if you are a master in Performance, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus instead.".
[22:35:44]: Start: 325.
[22:35:44]: Removing a Tags From "You descend from a talented line of strix storytellers. From the highest mountains and purest landscapes where your lungs fill with glorious clean air, you trill, whistle, and croon sweet songs. While natural sounds make you predisposed to sing, voices make you predisposed to mimicry. You receive a +1 circumstance bonus on Deception checks to <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Actions.aspx?ID=46">Impersonate</a> a mimicked voice, where the sound of the voice is the only factor; if you are a master in Deception, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus instead. You also gain a +1 circumstance bonus on <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Skills.aspx?ID=12">Performance</a> checks to sing; if you are a master in Performance, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus instead.".

[22:35:44]: Removing a Tags From "You descend from a talented line of strix storytellers. [22:35:44]: Start: 541.
[22:35:44]: ['Songbird Strix', 'https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=150', 'Strix', 'You descend from a talented line of strix storytellers. From the highest mountains and purest landscapes where your lungs fill with glorious clean air, you trill, whistle, and croon sweet songs. While natural sounds make you predisposed to sing, voices make you predisposed to mimicry. You receive a +1 circumstance bonus on Deception checks to Impersonate a mimicked voice, where the sound of the voice is the only factor; if you are a master in Deception, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus instead. You also gain a +1 circumstance bonus on Performance checks to sing; if you are a master in Performance, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus instead.'].

[22:35:50]: Added "['Ancient-Blooded Dwarf', 'https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=1', 'Dwarf', 'Dwarven heroes of old could shrug off their enemies’ magic, and some of that resistance manifests in you. You gain the Call on Ancient Blood reaction.']", "['Anvil Dwarf', 'https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=31', 'Dwarf', 'You are a descendant of a famed crafter and have your own amazing talent. Other dwarves might consider this a blessing from your ancestors or from the Forgefather himself, depending on where you grew up. You become trained in Crafting (or another skill if you were already trained in Crafting) and gain the Specialty Crafting skill feat, but you can pick two different specialties instead of one.']", "['Death Warden Dwarf', 'https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=2', 'Dwarf', 'Your ancestors have been tomb guardians for generations, and the power they cultivated to ward off necromancy has passed on to you. If you roll a success on a saving throw against a necromancy effect, you get a critical success instead.']", "['Elemental Heart Dwarf', 'https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=32', 'Dwarf', "Whether through a connection to Torag's forge, the azers of the Plane of Fire, or another source, you can exude a burst of energy. Mbe'ke and Taralu dwarves of the Mwangi Expanse believe this heritage is a gift from dragons or elemental spirits. Choose one of the following damage types: acid, cold, electricity, or fire. Once chosen, this can't be changed. You gain the Energy Emanation activity."]" to Organized Data.

You become trained in Crafting (or another skill if you were already trained in Crafting) and gain the Specialty Crafting skill feat, but you can pick two different specialties instead of one.']", "['Death Warden Dwarf', 'https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=2', 'Dwarf', 'Your ancestors have been tomb guardians for generations, and the power they cultivated to ward off necromancy has passed on to you. If you roll a success on a saving throw against a necromancy effect, you get a critical success instead.']", "['Elemental Heart Dwarf', 'https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=32', 'Dwarf', "Whether through a connection to Torag's forge, the azers of the Plane of Fire, or another source, you can exude a burst of energy. Mbe'ke and Taralu dwarves of the Mwangi Expanse believe this heritage is a gift from dragons or elemental spirits. Choose one of the following damage types: acid, cold, electricity, or fire. Once chosen, this can't be changed. You gain the Energy Emanation activity."]" to Organized Data.

If you roll a success on a saving throw against a necromancy effect, you get a critical success instead.']", "['Elemental Heart Dwarf', 'https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=32', 'Dwarf', "Whether through a connection to Torag's forge, the azers of the Plane of Fire, or another source, you can exude a burst of energy. Mbe'ke and Taralu dwarves of the Mwangi Expanse believe this heritage is a gift from dragons or elemental spirits. Choose one of the following damage types: acid, cold, electricity, or fire. Once chosen, this can't be changed. You gain the Energy Emanation activity."]" to Organized Data.

You gain the Call on Ancient Blood reaction.']", "['Anvil Dwarf', 'https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=31', 'Dwarf', 'You are a descendant of a famed crafter and have your own amazing talent. Mbe'ke and Taralu dwarves of the Mwangi Expanse believe this heritage is a gift from dragons or elemental spirits. Choose one of the following damage types: acid, cold, electricity, or fire. Once chosen, this can't be changed. You gain the Energy Emanation activity."]" to Organized Data.
[22:35:50]: Added "['Ancient-Blooded Dwarf', 'https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=1', 'Dwarf', 'Dwarven heroes of old could shrug off their enemies’ magic, and some of that resistance manifests in you. You gain the Call on Ancient Blood reaction.']", "['Anvil Dwarf', 'https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=31', 'Dwarf', 'You are a descendant of a famed crafter and have your own amazing talent. Other dwarves might consider this a blessing from your ancestors or from the Forgefather himself, depending on where you grew up. Once chosen, this can't be changed. You gain the Energy Emanation activity."]" to Organized Data.
[22:35:50]: Added "['Ancient-Blooded Dwarf', 'https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=1', 'Dwarf', 'Dwarven heroes of old could shrug off their enemies’ magic, and some of that resistance manifests in you. You gain the Call on Ancient Blood reaction.']", "['Anvil Dwarf', 'https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=31', 'Dwarf', 'You are a descendant of a famed crafter and have your own amazing talent. Other dwarves might consider this a blessing from your ancestors or from the Forgefather himself, depending on where you grew up. You become trained in Crafting (or another skill if you were already trained in Crafting) and gain the Specialty Crafting skill feat, but you can pick two different specialties instead of one.']", "['Death Warden Dwarf', 'https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=2', 'Dwarf', 'Your ancestors have been tomb guardians for generations, and the power they cultivated to ward off necromancy has passed on to you. Once chosen, this can't be changed. You gain the Energy Emanation activity."]" to Organized Data.

You gain the Call on Ancient Blood reaction.']", "['Anvil Dwarf', 'https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=31', 'Dwarf', 'You are a descendant of a famed crafter and have your own amazing talent. Other dwarves might consider this a blessing from your ancestors or from the Forgefather himself, depending on where you grew up. You become trained in Crafting (or another skill if you were already trained in Crafting) and gain the Specialty Crafting skill feat, but you can pick two different specialties instead of one.']", "['Death Warden Dwarf', 'https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=2', 'Dwarf', 'Your ancestors have been tomb guardians for generations, and the power they cultivated to ward off necromancy has passed on to you. If you roll a success on a saving throw against a necromancy effect, you get a critical success instead.']", "['Elemental Heart Dwarf', 'https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=32', 'Dwarf', "Whether through a connection to Torag's forge, the azers of the Plane of Fire, or another source, you can exude a burst of energy. Mbe'ke and Taralu dwarves of the Mwangi Expanse believe this heritage is a gift from dragons or elemental spirits. Choose one of the following damage types: acid, cold, electricity, or fire. Once chosen, this can't be changed. You gain the Energy Emanation activity."]" to Organized Data.

You become trained in Crafting (or another skill if you were already trained in Crafting) and gain the Specialty Crafting skill feat, but you can pick two different specialties instead of one.']", "['Death Warden Dwarf', 'https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=2', 'Dwarf', 'Your ancestors have been tomb guardians for generations, and the power they cultivated to ward off necromancy has passed on to you. If you roll a success on a saving throw against a necromancy effect, you get a critical success instead.']", "['Elemental Heart Dwarf', 'https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=32', 'Dwarf', "Whether through a connection to Torag's forge, the azers of the Plane of Fire, or another source, you can exude a burst of energy. Mbe'ke and Taralu dwarves of the Mwangi Expanse believe this heritage is a gift from dragons or elemental spirits. Choose one of the following damage types: acid, cold, electricity, or fire. Once chosen, this can't be changed. You gain the Energy Emanation activity."]" to Organized Data.

If you roll a success on a saving throw against a necromancy effect, you get a critical success instead.']", "['Elemental Heart Dwarf', 'https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=32', 'Dwarf', "Whether through a connection to Torag's forge, the azers of the Plane of Fire, or another source, you can exude a burst of energy. Mbe'ke and Taralu dwarves of the Mwangi Expanse believe this heritage is a gift from dragons or elemental spirits. Choose one of the following damage types: acid, cold, electricity, or fire. Once chosen, this can't be changed. You gain the Energy Emanation activity."]" to Organized Data.

You gain the Call on Ancient Blood reaction.']", "['Anvil Dwarf', 'https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=31', 'Dwarf', 'You are a descendant of a famed crafter and have your own amazing talent. Mbe'ke and Taralu dwarves of the Mwangi Expanse believe this heritage is a gift from dragons or elemental spirits. Choose one of the following damage types: acid, cold, electricity, or fire. Once chosen, this can't be changed. You gain the Energy Emanation activity."]" to Organized Data.
[22:35:50]: Added "['Ancient-Blooded Dwarf', 'https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=1', 'Dwarf', 'Dwarven heroes of old could shrug off their enemies’ magic, and some of that resistance manifests in you. You gain the Call on Ancient Blood reaction.']", "['Anvil Dwarf', 'https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=31', 'Dwarf', 'You are a descendant of a famed crafter and have your own amazing talent. Other dwarves might consider this a blessing from your ancestors or from the Forgefather himself, depending on where you grew up. Once chosen, this can't be changed. You gain the Energy Emanation activity."]" to Organized Data.
[22:35:50]: Added "['Ancient-Blooded Dwarf', 'https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=1', 'Dwarf', 'Dwarven heroes of old could shrug off their enemies’ magic, and some of that resistance manifests in you. You gain the Call on Ancient Blood reaction.']", "['Anvil Dwarf', 'https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=31', 'Dwarf', 'You are a descendant of a famed crafter and have your own amazing talent. Other dwarves might consider this a blessing from your ancestors or from the Forgefather himself, depending on where you grew up. You become trained in Crafting (or another skill if you were already trained in Crafting) and gain the Specialty Crafting skill feat, but you can pick two different specialties instead of one.']", "['Death Warden Dwarf', 'https://2e.aonprd.com/Heritages.aspx?ID=2', 'Dwarf', 'Your ancestors have been tomb guardians for generations, and the power they cultivated to ward off necromancy has passed on to you. Once chosen, this can't be changed. You gain the Energy Emanation activity."]" to Organized Data.
